Three types of biological fluids were used as sources of these vesicles: uterine aspirates from OC patients and healthy donors, malignant ascites from patients with advanced stages of OC, and conditioned media obtained from OC cells isolated from ascites and grown in short-term primary cultures in vitro.

EV isolated method:
To isolate small EVs, a standard protocol of differential ultracentrifugation, as described by Théry et al. [27], was employed with minor modifications in accordance with the protocol previously described [24,28]

Three types of biological fluids were used as sources of these vesicles: uterine aspirates from OC patients and healthy donors, malignant ascites from patients with advanced stages of OC, and conditioned media obtained from OC cells isolated from ascites and grown in short-term primary cultures in vitro.

EV isolated method:
To isolate small EVs, a standard protocol of differential ultracentrifugation, as described by Théry et al. [27], was employed with minor modifications in accordance with the protocol previously described [24,28]
